data.value: The lines of the array along the given axis are filtered by a spline filter. The order of the spline must be >= 2 and <= 5.
All of the interpolation functions in
do spline interpolation of the input image. If using B-splines of

, the input image values have to be converted to B-spline coefficients first, which is done by applying this 1-D filter sequentially along all axes of the input. All functions that require B-spline coefficients will automatically filter their inputs, a behavior controllable with the
keyword argument. For functions that accept a
parameter, the result will only be correct if it matches the
, this function processes the real and imaginary components independently.
The order of the spline, default is 3.
The axis along which the spline filter is applied. Default is the last axis.
The array in which to place the output, or the dtype of the returned array. Default is
parameter determines how the input array is extended beyond its boundaries. Default is 'mirror'. Behavior for each valid value is as follows (see additional plots and details on
The input is extended by reflecting about the edge of the last     pixel. This mode is also sometimes referred to as half-sample     symmetric.
d c b a | a b c d | d c b a
The input is extended by filling all values beyond the edge with     the same constant value, defined by the
parameter. No     interpolation is performed beyond the edges of the input.
k k k k | a b c d | k k k k
The input is extended by filling all values beyond the edge with     the same constant value, defined by the
parameter. Interpolation     occurs for samples outside the input's extent  as well.
k k k k | a b c d | k k k k
The input is extended by replicating the last pixel.
a a a a | a b c d | d d d d
The input is extended by reflecting about the center of the last     pixel. This mode is also sometimes referred to as whole-sample     symmetric.
d c b | a b c d | c b a
The input is extended by wrapping around to the opposite edge.
a b c d | a b c d | a b c d

The input is extended by wrapping around to the opposite edge, but in a     way such that the last point and initial point exactly overlap. In this     case it is not well defined which sample will be chosen at the point of     overlap.
d b c d | a b c d | b c a b
Calculate a 1-D spline filter along the given axis.
